00035 #include "screen.h"
00036 #include "utils.h"

00038 
00039 bool Screen::m_resizeEventOccurred = false;
00040 int Screen::m_newRows = -1;
00041 int Screen::m_newCols = -1;
00042 
00046 #define BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT 0
00047 
00048 /* Constructor. */
00049 Screen::Screen()
00050 {
00051     Screen::m_resizeEventOccurred = false;
00052     Screen::m_newRows = -1;
00053     Screen::m_newCols = -1;
00054     m_screenMode = screen_mode_components;
00055     m_page = 1;
00056     m_isNewMode = false;
00057     m_rows = m_newRows;
00058     m_cols = m_newCols;
00059     (void) signal(SIGINT, Screen::finish);         /* arrange interrupts to terminate */
00060     (void) signal(SIGWINCH, Screen::screenResize); /* Catch the resize signal */
00061     m_rows = m_newRows;
00062     m_cols = m_newCols;
00063 
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 /* Destructor. */
00068 Screen::~Screen()
00069 {
00070 }
00071 
00072 /*
00073  * Initialize the curses screen.
00074  */
00075 void Screen::init()
00076 {
00077     initscr();      /* initialize the curses library */
00078     keypad(stdscr, TRUE);  /* enable keyboard mapping */
00079     (void) nonl();         /* tell curses not to do NL->CR/NL on output */
00080     (void) cbreak();       /* take input chars one at a time, no wait for \n */
00081     (void) noecho();
00082     timeout(1);
00083 
00084     if (has_colors())
00085     {
00086         start_color();
00087 
00088         /*
00089          * Simple color assignment, often all we need.  Color pair 0 cannot
00090          * be redefined.  This example uses the same value for the color
00091          * pair as for the foreground color, though of course that is not
00092          * necessary:
00093          */
00094         init_pair(1, COLOR_RED,     COLOR_BLACK);
00095         init_pair(2, COLOR_GREEN,   COLOR_BLACK);
00096         init_pair(3, COLOR_YELLOW,  COLOR_BLACK);
00097         init_pair(4, COLOR_BLUE,    COLOR_BLACK);
00098         init_pair(5, COLOR_CYAN,    COLOR_BLACK);
00099         init_pair(6, COLOR_MAGENTA, COLOR_BLACK);
00100         init_pair(7, COLOR_WHITE,   COLOR_BLACK);
00101         init_pair(8, COLOR_RED,   COLOR_RED);
00102         init_pair(9, COLOR_CYAN,   COLOR_CYAN);
00103         init_pair(10, COLOR_GREEN,   COLOR_GREEN);
00104         init_pair(11, COLOR_BLACK,   COLOR_BLACK);
00105         init_pair(12, COLOR_BLACK,   COLOR_YELLOW);
00106     }
00107 
00108     drawBottomMenu();
00109 
00110 }
00111 
00112 /*
00113  * Handles the screen rezise, which comes in as the result
00114  * of a SIGWINCH signal.
00115  * Executes the program "resize" to read in the terminal size.
00116  *
00117  * @param sig the signal.
00118  */
00119 void Screen::screenResize(int sig)
00120 {
00121     Screen::m_resizeEventOccurred = true;
00122     FILE *fp = popen("resize", "r");
00123     if(fp)
00124     {
00125         char line[64];
00126         memset(line, 0, 64);
00127         while(fgets(line, sizeof(line)-1, fp))
00128         {
00129             if(strstr(line, "COLUMNS"))
00130             {
00131                 Screen::m_newCols = atol(line + 16);
00132             }
00133             else if(strstr(line, "LINES"))
00134             {
00135                 Screen::m_newRows = atol(line + 14);
00136             }
00137             memset(line, 0, 64);
00138         }
00139 
00140         fclose(fp);
00141     }
00142 }
00143 
00144 /*
00145  * Catch the control-c to quit screen mode then exit.
00146  *
00147  * @param sig the signal.
00148  */
00149 void Screen::finish(int sig)
00150 {
00151     endwin();
00152     exit(0);
00153 }

00202 
00203 /*
00204  * paint the screen.
00205  *
00206  * @param details the instance of the object containing the
00207  * information to display on the screen.
00208  */
00209 void Screen::paint(Details *details)
00210 {
00211     bool shouldRefresh = false;
00212     string line;
00213 
00214     if(Screen::m_resizeEventOccurred == true)
00215     {
00216         Screen::m_resizeEventOccurred = false;
00217         m_rows = m_newRows;
00218         m_cols = m_newCols;
00219         shouldRefresh = true; 
00220         endwin();
00221         init();
00222         clear();
00223         drawBottomMenu();
00224     }
00225 
00226     if(m_screenMode == details->getType())
00227     {
00228         if(m_page > details->getNumPages(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT))
00229             m_page = details->getNumPages(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT);
00230 
00231         if(m_isNewMode == true)
00232         {
00233             m_page = details->getCurrentPageNumber();
00234             m_isNewMode = false;
00235             clear();
00236             shouldRefresh = true;
00237         }
00238         if(details->paint(m_page, m_cols, m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT))
00239         {
00240             shouldRefresh = true;
00241         }
00242     }
00243 
00244     //Print the page
00245     line = "Page " + Utils::itos(m_page) + " of " + 
00246         Utils::itos(details->getNumPages(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT));
00247     move(0, m_cols-line.size());
00248     addstr(line.c_str());
00249 
00250     if(details->getNumPages(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT) == m_page)
00251         line = "8=PgDn";
00252     else if(m_page == 1)
00253         line = "9=PgUp";
00254     else
00255         line = "8=PgDn, 9=PgUp";
00256     move(1, m_cols-line.size());
00257     line += "     ";
00258     addstr(line.c_str() );
00259 
00260     //Park cursor
00261     move(m_rows-1, m_cols-1);
00262 
00263     if(shouldRefresh == true)
00264     {
00265         refresh();
00266     }
00267 
00268 }
00269

00271  * Process key presses.
00272  *
00273  * @param details the Details object to redraw of a key affects
00274  * the screen.
00275  */
00276 void Screen::processKey(Details *details)
00277 {
00278     char key[5];
00279 
00280     int ch = getch();
00281 
00282     //Print the keypress in the lower left corner
00283     //For debugging keypresses
00284     /*
00285        if(ch != -1)
00286        {
00287        sprintf(key, "%d", ch);
00288        move(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT, m_cols-4 );
00289        addstr("    ");
00290        move(m_rows-BOTTOM_MENU_HEIGHT, m_cols-4 );
00291        addstr(key);
00292        }
00293      */
00294 
00296     /*
00297     if(ch == 49)
00298     {
00299     m_screenMode = screen_mode_components;
00300     m_isNewMode = true;

00302     refresh();
00303     }
00304     if(ch == 50)
00305     {
00306     m_screenMode = screen_mode_signals;
00307     m_isNewMode = true;
00308     drawBottomMenu();
00309     refresh();
00310     }
00311     if(ch == 51)
00312     {
00313     m_screenMode = screen_mode_errors;
00314     m_isNewMode = true;
00315     drawBottomMenu();
00316     refresh();
00317     }
00318     if(ch == 52)
00319     {
00320     m_screenMode = screen_mode_summary;
00321     m_isNewMode = true;
00322     drawBottomMenu();
00323     refresh();
00324     }
00325      */
00326 
00327     //Decrement the page if the '8' key is pressed.
00328     if(ch == 56)
00329     {
00330         m_page--;
00331         if(m_page <1 ) m_page = 1;        
00332         drawBottomMenu();
00333         paint(details);
00334         refresh();
00335     }
00336 
00337     //Increment the page if the '9' key is pressed.
00338     if(ch == 57)
00339     {
00340         m_page++;
00341         drawBottomMenu();
00342         paint(details);
00343         refresh();
00344     }
00345 
00346 
00347 }
